{{Lead too short|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox football association | Logo = <!-- Do NOT place a non-free image here without complying with WP:NFCC #10c --> | Badge_size = 99px | Founded = 1892 | FIFA affiliation = 1952 | Region = [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] | Region affiliation = 1954 | President = [[Mayor]] [[Zainudin bin Nordin]] | Director of Football = Slobodan Pavkovic }}
The '''Football Association of Singapore (FAS)''' is the governing body of [[football (soccer)|football]] in [[Singapore]]. It was founded in 1952. Prior to that, the '''Singapore Amateur Football Association''', founded in 1892, was the governing body for football in Singapore. The Singapore Amateur Football Association lays claim to being the oldest Football Association in Asia.
The FAS is responsible for the organisation and development of football in Singapore, including its flagship [[S-League]] and the [[Singapore national football team]].
==Presidents==
*[[Soh Ghee Soon]]: Early 1950s - 1963 *[[Hussein Kumari]]: 1963- *[[N Ganesan]]: 1974 - 1981 *[[Abbas Abu Amin]]: 1989-1991 *[[Mah Bow Tan]] *[[Ho Peng Kee]] *Mayor [[Zainudin bin Nordin]], 2009-

* [[Vice-Presidents]] = Lt-Gen (Ret) Ng Jui Ping - (Independent Director of Pacific Andes and the Chairman of the Nominating and Remuneration Committees of the Pacific Andes). * [[Vice-Presidents]] = Mr. Tan Soo Nan - ([[CEO]] of [[Singapore Pools]]). * [[Vice-Presidents]] = Assoc Prof John Koh * [[Vice-Presidents]] = Mr. Lim Kia Tong
* [[General Secretary]] = Winston Lee * [[Deputy General Secretary]] = P.Sivakumar
* [[Hon. Treasurer]] = Mr. Samuel G. Panthradil
